Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black: band of alternating red and black tongues with added white outline; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goat rearing to left (forelegs remaining); at left, part of undetermined motif; part of swastika, dotted rosette and elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Goats are not frequently found on Mature Animal Style vases.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 265, no. 574, pl. 72, no. 574) (Incorrectly labelled UCL 798)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 68)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0575) (phase 2)
